  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: EMPLOYEE LOADED A LEAKING FULLY REGULATED OXIDIZER CORROSIVE 51(8) HYDROGEN PEROXIDE 35%.IT LEAKED ON HIS HAND HE COMPLAINED THAT IT WAS BURNING.THE SUP CALL HAZMAT RESPONDER. THE RESPONDERRESPONDED TO THIS SPILL WEARING HIS FULL PPE AND DECISION TREE/RESPONSE SHEET. HE THEN CLEAN UP THE SPILL AND TRASMPORTED BACK TO HAZMAT CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT PROCESSING AREA AND INFORMATION WAS COLLECTED ON ALL SIX SIDES, PACKAGE CONTENTS WAS SOLIDIFIED AND MATERIAL WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP. THE PROCESSED MATERIAL WAS PLACED IN THE UNCONFIRMED DMP AREA UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE.

item.title: Report X-2024100141
item.description:
Report X-2024100141

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-03T09:21:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-18
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER DONNED FULL PPE AND HAD DECISION TREE AND SPILL CART. FOLLOWING THE RESPONSE SHEET FOR AN UNKNOWN CONTENTS, DISCOVERED IT WAS A CORROSIVE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL ACCORDING TO THE CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET PAGE. RESPONDER BROUGHT THE SPILL BACK TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING AND DISCOVERED WHAT WAS AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT. CALLED HMSC FOR FURTHER INSTRUCTION.

item.title: Report I-2024090066
item.description:
Report I-2024090066

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-03T09:21:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-12
  • City: Kankakee
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: N&M TRANSFER
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. While staged at yard, a leak was detected coming from trailer. Area was isolated and Environmental Restoration LLC was dispatched to perform cleanup. Upon arrival on site, ERLLC applied absorbent material to the free product beneath trailer, and performed trailer inspection. One 55-gallon drum was discovered at nose of trailer, which appeared to be struck by a nail during transit or loading process. ERLLC utilized absorbent material to clean the trailer floor, overpacked the Ieaking drum, and reloaded trailer. Product was scraped from impacted area and containerized with spent absorbent into one 55-gallon drum. Three drums were generated during response. One overpack drum, which contained the damaged drum, one 55-gallon recovery drum with contaminated cardboard, and one 55-gallon drum of spent absorbents, gravel, and poly sheeting. Free product was contained to immediate area and did not threaten to impact state waters. There were no injuries or exposures reported.

  • Description: PACKAGE CONTAIN 4 1 GL PLASTIC BOTTLES OF M-1 DECK ROOF CLEANER WHICH LEAKED AT THE CLOSURE.THE CAP CAME LOOSE.THE ENTIRE CONTENTS GOT PROCESSED THRU DMP.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER CLEANED UP SPILL USING THE DECISION TREE AND CORRESPONDING RESPONSE/CONTAINMENT SHEET. RESPONDER BROUGHT SPILL BACK TO THE CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON OPENING THE PACKAGE, RESPONDER NOTICED CAP WAS LOOSE ON THE 5 GALLON CONTAINER. RESPONDER CLOSED UP THE CONTAINER BY CLOSING THE CAP UP. RESPONDER PROCESSED CONTAINER WITH LIQUID AS A WHOLE, PROCESSED THE CONTAMINATED DEBRIS AS WELL.

item.title: Report E-2024090560
item.description:
Report E-2024090560

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-17
  • City: MATTESON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 17, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1791 was punctured by a pallet and released approximately thirty (30) gallons of product to the trailer interior and the concrete beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and a neutralizing agent to remediate the UN1791-impacted trailer and concrete. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon overpack all impacted material was collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report E-2024090542
item.description:
Report E-2024090542

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-31
  • City: S CHICAGO HEIGHTS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0219 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at XCH. It was reported approximately 150 gallons of 330-gallon plastic tote released from a 330-gallon plastic tote due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted the concrete between dock doors 160-166. Upon the contractor's arrival, personnel observed the released material impacted a 35'x25' area of the trailer floor. Contractor's containerized (3) 55-gallon poly drums with product impacted oil dry, absorbent pads and PPE. The waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report I-2024090049
item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-09
  • City: PALATINE
  • State: IL

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: LEAKING PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP CAGE BY THE RESPONDER. DISCOVERED IT WAS NICOTINE WITH NO PAPERS/DIAGRAMS ON THE BOX. CALLED SUPERVISOR F OR ASSISTANCE. HE CALLED THE HAZMAT SUPPORT CENTER. WE WERE INSTRUCTED TO HOLD ALL CONTENTS OF THE PACKAGE UNTIL FURTHER INSPECTION. CONTENTS AR E PLACED IN TOTES WITH LABEL TO HOLD FOR INSPECTION IN THE DMP CAGE. LITHIUM ION BATTERIES CONTAINED IN EQUIPMENT- VAPE CONTAINING NICOTINE AND TWO x 1 QUART BOTTLES OF PURE NICOTINE. PART VII- RECOMMENDATIONS/ACTIONS TAKEN TO PREVENT RECURRENCE
